definition: stab of pain/sting/fig. stimulus to action/a prick
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: Pricks his thin claw within some delicate nerve;
sentences.chinese: 以尖刻的爪子，刺痛敏感的神經。

sentences.english: What better way to hurt them than with the subversive idea of freedom?
sentences.chinese: 有什麼能夠比針鋒相對的自由思想更能刺痛他們呢？

sentences.english: At very high intensities, nuclear radiations cause itching and tingling of the skin.
sentences.chinese: 當核輻射強度很高時，它能使皮膚感到發癢和刺痛。

sentences.english: Bamboo fence that lines the dying rose, hurt people 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 竹籬笆旁那株即將凋謝的玫瑰，刺痛了路人的心。

sentences.english: Do you ever have any prickling feelings in your legs or feet? Yes No.
sentences.chinese: 你的下肢或雙足出現過刺痛的感覺嗎？

sentences.english: King Lear says he wouldexceptnecceties accept necessity's sharp pinch.
sentences.chinese: 里爾王稱他將接受必要的刺痛。

sentences.english: What she done hurt my heart deeply.
sentences.chinese: 她的行爲深深地刺痛了我的心。

sentences.english: Dirty air or air-borne garbage causes stinging eyes and running nose.
sentences.chinese: 骯髒的空氣或空氣傳播的垃圾引起眼睛刺痛和流鼻涕。

sentences.english: Her fingers tingled with the cold.
She suddenly sting, but also in itself.
sentences.chinese: 她忽然心中刺痛，卻也倍覺輕鬆。

sentences.english: A deep ache tugged at her and tears stung her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一種疼痛牽引着她，連淚水都刺痛她的眼睛。

sentences.english: However the application itself will sting and hurt a bit.
sentences.chinese: 然而這種方法本身會使人感到一點刺痛和疼痛。

sentences.english: What stuck most in Chinese craws was that resident British ambassador.
sentences.chinese: 最刺痛中國人神經的是允許英國領事常駐北京。
我的皮膚有時感到刺痛。

sentences.english: His hands tingled with the cold.
If a Portuguese man-of-war stings you it will be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 如果一所葡文人爲的戰爭刺痛你會很痛苦。

definition: to sneak in/to infiltrate/to be piercingly painful/to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)
to throb with pain/throbbing pain/twang/pang/CL:陣|阵[zhen4]
to ache/to be sore/to feel painful
sharp pain/cramp/griping pain/colic/angina, cf 心絞痛|心绞痛
